title: ‘We just do it’: Massachusetts plow drivers recount 24-hour shift during blizzard
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts plow drivers worked 24-hour shifts to clear snow after a Feb. 23 blizzard dropped up to 3 feet statewide.
Supply shortages of ice melt and equipment issues complicated snow removal efforts in areas like Weymouth and Boston.
Plow crews faced tough shifts due to severe weather, yet remained committed to keeping roads open and assisting the community.

title: 4 charged in alleged $7M pandemic relief fraud scheme
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Four people, including a Boston man and three from Florida, were charged with conspiracy to commit wire fraud in a COVID-19 relief scam.
The group allegedly obtained $7 million by submitting fraudulent Paycheck Protection Program applications and collecting kickbacks from ineligible borrowers.
Jean-Jacques and Pierre face additional charges for conspiracy to commit wire and bank fraud in a separate mortgage and lease scheme.

title: Orange Line to shut down between Back Bay and Forest Hills for 9 days
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: The MBTA will suspend Orange Line service between Back Bay and Forest Hills for nine days starting February 28.
Free shuttle buses and commuter rail service will be available, potentially adding 30 minutes to travel times for riders.
The shutdown supports signal upgrades, replacing analog systems with digital infrastructure to enhance efficiency and reliability.

title: Missing Weymouth man found dead after blizzard
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Brendan L. Rogers, 45, was found dead in a wooded area off the Fore River after going missing Monday.
Rogers disappeared during a nor’easter that brought over 18 inches of snow to Weymouth, Massachusetts.
Weymouth Police, assisted by state and environmental police, found Rogers's body without any signs of foul play.

title: 68-year-old man pronounced dead after reported neighbor dispute in Middleborough
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 68-year-old man was pronounced dead after a reported neighbor dispute at 21 School St. in Middleborough.
Authorities arrested another man at the scene, charging him with assault and battery on a police officer.
The Massachusetts State Police and Middleborough Police are investigating; the death cause is pending from the medical examiner.

title: Here’s Dave Epstein on what to expect — generally — this March
author: David Epstein
bullets: March in Boston will start with one last Arctic air burst, feeling like winter.
The first week of March may bring more snow due to a possible storm system.
Second week of March is anticipated to be milder, potentially reaching temperatures of 60 degrees or higher.

title: Third victim reportedly dies after Pawtucket ice rink shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Gerald Dorgan, 75, died after being hospitalized for injuries from the February 16 shooting at Dennis M. Lynch Arena.
The shooter, Robert Dorgan, attacked his ex-wife and family members in a targeted dispute before dying by suicide.
A GoFundMe page supports surviving family members Ava Dorgan and a high school senior after the incident.

title: Cat saved after days stuck in a tree following the blizzard that blanketed Rhode Island
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matt Lyons rescued cat Pixie from a 50-foot tree after Rhode Island's record blizzard.
The cat was stuck for two days; emergency services advised seeking tree services for help.
Neighbor Heather MacKinnon shared the situation on Nextdoor, leading Lyons to climb and save Pixie.

title: 4 questions facing Bruins as they return from Olympic break
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins resume play Thursday against Columbus Blue Jackets after a three-week Olympic break.
Bruins hold second Wild Card spot with a 32-20-5 record and face 25 games to end the season.
Team's focus includes improving penalty kill and potential trades before March 6 trade deadline.

title: Fire erupts at MCI-Norfolk prison, no major injuries reported
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Fire broke out in MCI-Norfolk's housing unit, quickly extinguished, no major injuries reported.
Three incarcerated individuals treated for smoke inhalation; staff member went to hospital as precaution.
Norfolk Fire Department responded at 1:30 p.m.; cause of fire remains under investigation.
